data.title: Excelent steak house
data.text:
Excelent steak house  with a great  variety of  wines.
Steak was just as we ordered.
Restaurant had a  beautiful presentation
service was  not fantastic but nothing to complaint about

data.title: Steakhouse
data.text: We went there for a birthday celebration, the wait staff initially had us seated close to the kitchen, but they worked with us to have us seated in a better location, the staff were friendly and attentive and the food was very good.

data.title: Wonderful
data.text: Start with the Key Lime Pie. Wowza. Wish I had more room to enjoy  more than a bite of that amazing dessert!

data.title: Fantastic!
data.text: The service here begins on the drive and doesn't stop. Truly an unexpected experience in the heart of downtown Oklahoma City. Fantastic wine list with great staff recommendations.  Hopefully you'll get a chance to try the Bison special. If not, splurge on the steak.  From one very picky steak person - this was a standout.

data.title: appetizers with friends on a Saturday night
data.text: We were staying next door at the Colcord Hotel and walked next door for appetizers.  Their appetizers are great.  Service is outstanding.  Great atmosphere.

data.title: Unbelievable steaks!
data.text: We celebrated some family accomplishments here and WOW! we are all blown away by the food and the atmosphere. I typically "rate" restaurants by the quality of their cocktails. This one passed with flying colors! Of course, that was just a preparation for the food. I have eaten steaks around the world, but found these to be most tender, flavorful, and prepared exactly as requested. This place is a true culinary treat!

data.title: Just average
data.text: I visit a lot of high-end steakhouses in many cities so I was excited to visit this one during my stay in OKC.   The steak salad that I had was O.K. but it should have been outstanding for a place like this.    The others in my group didn't have anything stellar to say about their meals either.   Service was also bland in nature as well as the general ambiance of the place.

data.title: Celebrate
data.text: We took our daughter-in-law and son after she got a promotion at work.  It's a great place to go for a special occasion but I normally wouldn't spend this much on a meal.

data.title: First trip to OKC, looking for a great steakhouse.....
data.text:
We were spending a long weekend in OKC, and we're looking for a great steakhouse.  Mahogany came highly recommended so we gave it a try....

First the pros:

The restaurant is in a great central location in downtown, just down from Bricktown. 

It is beautiful, with great ambience, especially at dusk. We were seated in the bar area, and when they open the drapes, the view of the city is really nice.

Bread is brought to you quickly after being seated.  Menu has a nice variety of beef and seafood options.  Sides are alacarte, and are huge. We had both the mashed potatoes and steak fries.  Potatoes could have been a little more seasoned, but fries were great-crispy, with just enough salt.  

Cons:

We made a reservation, but were seated in the bar, not the dining room.  We should have been advised of that prior to completing the reservation.

While the manager was doing her rounds and seemed to be attentive, our two, yes two, waiters, were not good.  We were seated quickly, and my boyfriend advised that they could take his wine glass away; I however wanted time to review wine list.  Waiter number two came back to get my wine order, but, despite him just having water in front of him, assumed that was all my boyfriend was drinking.  Had to call him over to order a drink, and again for another one, after he waited for ten to fifteen minutes with an empty glass.

Regarding the food, we both ordered a steak, one the 14 oz ribeye, the other the 6 oz filet.  They were ordered medium well and medium rare respectively.  Both came over cooked, but we ate them as we did not wait to get new ones cooked.  

Waiters did very poor job doing regularly timed call backs, we were not asked about dessert or coffee after our meal, and then there was delay in getting our check. 

This place has a lot going for it, but there are areas for improvement, especially when dropping 100+ dollars for a meal.

data.title: Do Not Miss This One!
data.text: The service was outstanding, the portions were generous, the taste and quality of our food was nothing short of perfection. Not exaggerating when I say the dinner I had at the downtown Mahogany last night was the best meal I have ever had. Worth every penny.  They make sure you are 1000% happy with your service and food, they even make notes of your seating preferences for next time!! Every single detail is tailored to an unforgettable experience, they note what color clothes you are wearing and change the napkins to suit!  The décor is top notch and the atmosphere is welcoming.  Special occasions, need to impress a client, or just because you are worth it, do not miss out on this one!

data.title: The best food in the city, and the most beautiful restaurant in the city.
data.text: We ate there the week before Christmas and it was packed.  We love the one on Memorial Road, but this was our first time to the one downtown.  Same wonderful food and service, and an even more beautiful restaurant.  It was a little noisy because it was packed, but the food was superb.  I loved the bone-in cowboy ribeye, baked potato, lobster bisque, sweet corn, mushrooms, and rolls.  I consider it one of the three most special restaurants in Oklahoma (Boulevard Steakhouse and The Drake being the other two)  We will probably continue to go to the one Memorial more because it is closer, but we will go to this one when we go to a Thunder game (valet parking).

data.title: Very Good!
data.text: Not much to say. One of the best places in Oklahoma City. Very consistent in food and staff. This is one of my go to places when entertaining clients.

data.title: Birthday's
data.text: The service is great, the staff is great!  The steak could have been outstanding however the outside is covered in salt and chard which made it dry, they suggest sauces with their steak and with a great steak you need nothing, the center of the steak is great.  I'm disappointed that the steak has all the salt and chard when I ordered mine medium rare.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We were a group of 14 who had been relocated to Mahogany when our reservations at another restaurant were cancelled.  The food was excellent, although a little pricey.  We had a small room to ourselves which was nice.  The wait staff was very good and took care of our every need.  It was a short walk around the corner from our hotel.  It was so pleasant to watch the carriages go by and see the activity of downtown Oklahoma City.

data.title: Upscale steakhouse across from the Colcord
data.text: An excellent location for their second Mahogany location. A few new restaurant kinks need to be worked out, but our overall dining experience was excellent. The steaks had good flavor and are well prepared, the side dishes are large enough for several to share. The wine list was adequate for a restaurant of this type.

data.title: I like it, I like it a lot!
data.text:
Very nice - new so  bit hard to find.

Went here for a business dinner. Excellent waitstaff, excellent food, excellent atmosphere.

Started with a blue cheese wedge salad, my personal favorite. Next I enjoyed a prime cut New York strip steak. Very tender and flavorful and cooked perfectly; the waitstaff ensured that it was. Sides are family style, plenty to share. We enjoyed mac n' cheese, au gratin potatoes and asparagus with hollandaise. All very good. 

Dessert came after in the form of New York style cheesecake with mixed fruit on the side and a wee bit of chocolate sauce for dipping as needed. Accompanied by a coffee, it was the perfect finish.

I will be returning with my wife so she can enjoy the experience herself soon.

data.title: Less Than Stellar Opening
data.text:
They had been open 3 days when I went. I think you'd put your best game face on if you were just opening. They have 2 other amazing locations in Oklahoma, why did they put on such a pathetic opening.

I never thought I'd say this about a Lobster Cargot - but don't!! Too greasy, overcooked and with seasoning that reminded me of breakfast sausage. I even left a piece. At $29.99 for 6 pieces . . . well, you know where this is going. But it was so bad, I couldn't eat anymore. 

Their steak was good but not great. If a person likes their steak blue and you age it to long, it loses that luscious rare steak feel and taste. A rare steak should be butter but it was chewy and had marbling in a filet mignon. This made it greasy like a ribeye. In fact, I left some steak behind which never happens.

Their oscar topping was goo, with nice pieces of crab, but they steamed it and served it over asparagus (which I love, just not with crab.) This completely overwhelmed the delicate flavor of the crab and ruined it. 

Their Bernaise and Chimichurri sauces are excellent. But good sauces on bad food just doesn't suffice.

Their wine list - especially by the glass - are less than stellar. They have valet parking, which in this location is almost mandatory, and it's $10.00. I don't mine tipping for valet or even paying, but if it's virtually necessary by location, I feel like it's a surcharge. 

On the upside, the staff is well-trained and very attentive. Well, except they lost my reservation in their system. However, they were still able to seat me since this is their newest location and not everyone knows about it yet. Not worth the money or worthy of the Mahogany name. Go to Broadway 10, The George or the other Mahogany location. Massive fail.

data.title: Mahogany immer ein Erlebnis
data.text:
Vor vielen Jahren im "alten" Mahogany in der Memorial Road habe ich dieses Mal das Mahogany im Stadtzentrum in unmittelbarer Nähe des Devon Tower (höchstes Gebäude in OKC mit über 250 m) besucht.
Fragen Sie mich, wie es war?
Es war einfach toll und wer behauptet in den USA kann man nicht gut essen, der soll sich hier eines Besseren belehren lassen. Die Weinauswahl hält mit jedem europäischen Gourmettempel mit und das Speiseangebot sowieso.
Vorneweg phantastische Jacobsmuscheln und als Hauptgericht das "Bone-in-filet" und das müssen Sie unbedingt probieren. Ich habe noch keine besseren Steaks gegessen und sicher ist, wenn ich wieder mal bald in OKC sein werde: hier werde ich wieder sein.
Bitte unbedingt reservieren.
